Posts.Title: should I do biopsy...fluid has changed to clear?? sloth sloth

Posts.Content: Mar 5, 2007 08:26PM sherloc wrote: everything you've described sounds normal. The rash is probably from the tape. Shower if they told you you can. Don't need to use anything to clean the incision. Leave it alone and let the tape come off on it's own.
Posts.Title: Breast 3 days after lumpectomy Bethsoda jodigirl

Posts.Content: May 13, 2007 09:53AM sherloc wrote: I'm one of the lump in a jar girls. My take on it is if it is cancer another needle biopsy is a complete waste of time. Acutally I think any needle biopsy is a waste of time but thats just me. If its not cancer great and it's gone and you don't need to ever think about it again. Lumpectomy/excisional biopsy is a very easy surgery. I would get it out.
Posts.Title: total excisional biopsy or another needle biopsy? missz Beesie

Posts.Content: Jul 16, 2007 03:59AM sherloc wrote: bluewillow, my daughter was pregnant while I was going thru rads. No one ever told me to avoid contact with her. I even got the day off from treatment one day to attend her birth. My daughter has her babies at home and I was holding my new grandbaby a minute after she was born. Don't think they would have let me do that if I was radioactive. I don't think it is anything you have to worry about.

Posts.Content: Jun 24, 2007 08:19AM sherloc wrote: Hon they will biopsy your breast first before they check your nodes. You don't have to worry about it being missed that way. My understanding tho is not a lot of doctors out there know much about IBC so if you aren't satisfied with the answers you get by all means ask to see a specialist.

Posts.Content: Mar 23, 2007 02:26PM sherloc wrote: O geez. He was sure it is an infection but didn't give you RX? Hon, don't want to scare you but Always is right. With IBC you DO NOT have the luxury of time. It moves very quickly and is mean and nasty. Call your primary back and insist on a biopsy. You don't need a surgeon for a biopsy.

Posts.Content: Jul 20, 2007 03:29AM sherloc wrote: Ask for the Oncotype DX test. Not really sure what it is cause it wasn't available when I was dx but it tests your tumor somehow. The lower the score the less need for chemo. I'm sure someone that has had it done could explain it better.

Posts.Content: Oct 5, 2007 10:06AM - edited Oct 5, 2007 10:06AM by sherloc hmmmm maybe we aren't exactly the same. I just noticed the T1C. Does that mean you are grade 3? I think if that were the case for me I would have opted for chemo?
Posts.Title: Trying to decide about chemo somalley somalley

Posts.Content: Oct 5, 2007 10:04AM - edited Oct 5, 2007 10:04AM by sherloc Hi somally, I had the exact diagnosis as you and did not have chemo. I was dx in 2004 and oncotype dx test wasn't available yet. My onc told me chemo would only lower my recurrence risk my 1-2%. Have you had oncotype test? That would help with your decision. For me I decided the risks of chemo outweighed the benefit and decided to leave it for the future if I ever face this decision again.
